comment.body: I emailed with @plonga and we've agreed that SIDH and SIKE should, unfortunately, be removed. I think it would be appropriate to include that in the 0.7.2 release.

issue.title: SIKE p-503 and p-610 failing memory leak tests
issue.body:
When compiled using `clang-14` the latest SIKE code fails this valgrind test as follows (only for p-503 and p-610; all other parameters pass):
```
root@f9e0d5466559:~/project/build/tests# valgrind -s --error-exitcode=1 --leak-check=full --show-leak-kinds=all ./test_kem SIKE-p503
==7236== Memcheck, a memory error detector
==7236== Copyright (C) 2002-2017, and GNU GPL'd, by Julian Seward et al.
==7236== Using Valgrind-3.15.0 and LibVEX; rerun with -h for copyright info
==7236== Command: ./test_kem SIKE-p503
==7236== 
Configuration info
==================
Target platform:  x86_64-Linux-5.13.0-1023-aws
Compiler:         clang (14.0.6 )
Compile options:  [-march=skylake;-Werror;-Wall;-Wextra;-Wpedantic;-Wno-unused-command-line-argument;-O3;-fomit-frame-pointer;-Wbad-function-cast;-Wcast-qual;-Wnarrowing;-Wconversion]
OQS version:      0.7.2-dev
Git commit:       58b73c1044d7731b9210e4d6e6e919466323c134
OpenSSL enabled:  Yes (OpenSSL 1.1.1f  31 Mar 2020)
AES:              NI
SHA-2:            OpenSSL
SHA-3:            C
OQS build flags:  OQS_OPT_TARGET=skylake CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release 
CPU exts compile-time:  ADX AES AVX AVX2 BMI1 BMI2 PCLMULQDQ POPCNT SSE SSE2 SSE3

================================================================================
Sample computation for KEM SIKE-p503
================================================================================
shared secrets are equal
==7236== Thread 2:
==7236== Conditional jump or move depends on uninitialised value(s)
==7236==    at 0x4842225: bcmp (in /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/valgrind/vgpreload_memcheck-amd64-linux.so)
==7236==    by 0x10A726: kem_test_correctness (in /root/project/build/tests/test_kem)
==7236==    by 0x10A43B: test_wrapper (in /root/project/build/tests/test_kem)
==7236==    by 0x4C7F608: start_thread (pthread_create.c:477)
==7236==    by 0x4DB9132: clone (clone.S:95)
==7236== 
==7236== Conditional jump or move depends on uninitialised value(s)
==7236==    at 0x10A729: kem_test_correctness (in /root/project/build/tests/test_kem)
==7236==    by 0x10A43B: test_wrapper (in /root/project/build/tests/test_kem)
==7236==    by 0x4C7F608: start_thread (pthread_create.c:477)
==7236==    by 0x4DB9132: clone (clone.S:95)
==7236== 
==7236== 
==7236== HEAP SUMMARY:
==7236==     in use at exit: 0 bytes in 0 blocks
==7236==   total heap usage: 25 allocs, 25 frees, 27,372 bytes allocated
==7236== 
==7236== All heap blocks were freed -- no leaks are possible
==7236== 
==7236== Use --track-origins=yes to see where uninitialised values come from
==7236== ERROR SUMMARY: 2 errors from 2 contexts (suppressed: 0 from 0)
==7236== 
==7236== 1 errors in context 1 of 2:
==7236== Conditional jump or move depends on uninitialised value(s)
==7236==    at 0x10A729: kem_test_correctness (in /root/project/build/tests/test_kem)
==7236==    by 0x10A43B: test_wrapper (in /root/project/build/tests/test_kem)
==7236==    by 0x4C7F608: start_thread (pthread_create.c:477)
==7236==    by 0x4DB9132: clone (clone.S:95)
==7236== 
==7236== 
==7236== 1 errors in context 2 of 2:
==7236== Conditional jump or move depends on uninitialised value(s)
==7236==    at 0x4842225: bcmp (in /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/valgrind/vgpreload_memcheck-amd64-linux.so)
==7236==    by 0x10A726: kem_test_correctness (in /root/project/build/tests/test_kem)
==7236==    by 0x10A43B: test_wrapper (in /root/project/build/tests/test_kem)
==7236==    by 0x4C7F608: start_thread (pthread_create.c:477)
==7236==    by 0x4DB9132: clone (clone.S:95)
==7236== 
==7236== ERROR SUMMARY: 2 errors from 2 contexts (suppressed: 0 from 0)
```

comment.body: Will be address by removal of SIDH/SIKE #1268.
ACK. Shall #1267 then be re-based after this closes? I'd volunteer to update the downstream apps when you have a branch/PR ready for this.

issue.title: Bump oqs-sys/liboqs from `719a84e` to `fb0edb7`

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: submodules
labels.description: Pull requests that update Submodules code

issue.body:
Bumps [oqs-sys/liboqs](https://github.com/Open-Quantum-Safe/liboqs) from `719a84e` to `fb0edb7`.
Commits
  • fb0edb7 Updated to SIKE v3.5.1 (#1231)
  • 478ccba Remove Rainbow level 1 (#1263)
  • 2c687b1 pqclean_hqc: Fix build on GCC-12 (#1254)
  • 664c6f3 Fix memory leak detected by valgrind (#1250)
  • e88cc36 Sync Kyber with upstream, enable Scan-Build with Kyber (#1252)
  • 8ec5517 docs: Add valgrind as test dependencies in README.md (#1251)
  • 1a1e918 disable msys2 testing (#1243)
  • a8dad8d adding memory leak testing (#1234)
  • fbb34be adding scan-build test (#1240)
  • d402280 Updated Dilithium sign.c patch with AES context release (2) (#1242)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

comment.body:
> Removing from generate.yml is fine, but don't we also now need to re-run the templating script to actually remove it from the generated code?

This has been done. There's no code change visible as Rainbow hasn't been set to "enable" in the YML, i.e., effectively was not active.
A merge of this anyway would be premature as this can be combined with the removal of SIKE/SIDH, though.

> ACK. Shall #1267 then be re-based after this closes? 

That probably makes sense.

> I'd volunteer to update the downstream apps when you have a branch/PR ready for this.

Thanks.  I'll try to pull something together today for this.

issue.title: fixing FreeBSD runtime ARM CPU feature detection
issue.body:
Fixes #1266 .

As I have no real clue about FreeBSD nor ARM, can I ask @yurivict and @Martyrshot to take a close look at this?

* [no] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [no] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.)

comment.body: Thanks for fixing this Michael. It looks good from my point of view.

comment.body: I rebased on the SIKE removal to see if it fixes the build.
